list_definition.definition: a trace, or slight amount, of a colour/color

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her hair had a tinge of red.

list_ex_of_english: Many others are tinged with money-making influences, which seem to be a driving force behind their operations.
She said afterwards that she felt demeaned and that her day was one tinged with sadness.
The basal half of the forewings is whitish-grey tinged with ochreous, scattered with blackish scales on the costal area.
They were not even tinged with reality.
Of course, this occasion is tinged with some regret.
Our debate today is inevitably tinged with sadness.

We are not tinged with opposition to direct support of farming.
